OVERVIEW


FERC Electricity 101 provides a comprehensive overview of the agency’s impact on the electric power industry. This day and a half course is for those seeking a basic knowledge of FERC, those desiring a refresher course, and those who want to learn about the current hot topics at the agency.
 
 
WHO SHOULD ATTEND THIS COURSE:
 
Engineers, managers, members of the financial community, attorneys and anyone else who is interested or has a need to know about the laws governing FERC and its rules, policies and procedures that affect the electric industry. The course will benefit those seeking a basic knowledge of FERC, those desiring a refresher course, and those seeking insight on current agency proceedings involving electric power.
 
WHAT ATTENDEES WILL LEARN:
 
FERC has a large – and growing – presence in the electric industry, especially in light of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 ("EPAct"). Attendees will gain an understanding of the nature of the FERC role and how agency actions may affect regulated entities and the marketplace.
 
TESTIMONIALS FROM PAST ATTENDEES:
 
“Bravo. Information presented was well developed and current. I have a much better foundation in the industry: where its been, what’s happening now, and what to look for. Presenters were knowledgeable, experienced and engaging.” 
                      ~ L. W., Utility Policy Analyst, Missouri Public Service Commission
 
“Excellent overview and history of the development of the grid.” 
                      ~ A. W., Power Supply & Rates Analyst, UGI Utilities, Inc.
 
“I enjoyed the course and learned a great deal. Content clarified many questions I had regarding why our company does many things. Provided a great foundation that I can use to build my knowledge of the industry and also to perform my duties in my current position.” 
                      ~ M. G., Contract Analyst, Xcel Energy
 
“Course topics certainly provided "glue" regarding many FERC items with which I already had familiarity. It helped put it all together for me.”
                      ~ D. D., FERC Regulatory Affairs Manager, Aquila, Inc.
